Impossible Adventures
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher EVO Archive (PS2): Miscellaneous Q & A: Impossible Adventures
By Lightining on Monday, June 12, 2006 - 08:36 am:

Has anyone noticed that after you beat the game all the adventures are impossible to train in? How are we suoopsed to train new monsters when the adventures are impossible to train in. In Colno even when I had a team of all beginners, the monsters i faced had average of 668 life and supposedly other stats. Does anyone know where we are supposed to train newe monsters in adventures?

By Ito Saith Webb on Monday, June 12, 2006 - 07:04 pm:

The easiest way to solve this probelm is that have at least one old monster that has the strength to take the monsters down. Then it is a simple matter of taking the fledging monsters along for the ride to gain free anima.

By Snake_Judge on Saturday, June 17, 2006 - 06:25 pm:

or you can get anima points from the sparing offerd at the guild

By Slickriptide on Monday, June 19, 2006 - 02:41 pm:

So, yeah, you basically have to do what the MMO world would call "power-leveling". One guy does all the work and the other guys leech off of him to collect all the reward.

By darklao on Sunday, June 25, 2006 - 10:48 pm:

You can also pass on quite a bit of AP if one of your parent monsters has tons of spare. I have a Beaclon that has, oh, nearly 200K built up because he was my major monster for a while. If I mix him with a brand new monster that I immediately saucerize, the offspring gets something like 60K AP, which is more than enough to buy all techniques and set up whatever traits I could want.

By Lightining on Friday, July 7, 2006 - 07:39 pm:

Actually since I have been able to get monster stats up into the upper 20 levels I haven't had a single problem with adventures. Even the nameless corridor seems like an average adventure.

By Ito Saith Webb on Monday, July 10, 2006 - 11:06 pm:

Just to let you know Lightining that the nameless Corridor is key'd off the town your in. So if you are in the warp world the fights get tougher, and the boss fights are insane. Also S class misssions are very tough as well.

By Salokin on Thursday, August 9, 2007 - 12:09 pm:

To beat the adventures i just used my strongest monster with two others and just attacked with the strongest until the others were Ko'd.
